tags.name: Submissions
tags.description: Signature requests can be initiated with Submissions API. Submissions can contain one submitter if signed by a single party or multiple submitters if the document template form contains signatures and fields to be collected and filled by multiple parties. Initiate new submissions to request signatures for specified submitters via email or phone number.

tags.name: Submitters
tags.description: Submitters API allows you to load all details provided by the signer of the document.

tags.name: Templates
tags.description: Templates represent reusable document signing forms with fields and signatures to be collected. It's possible to create unique template forms with fields and signatures using HTML or with tagged PDFs.

get.description: The API endpoint provides the ability to retrieve a list of available document templates.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Filter templates based on the name partial match.

parameters.name: slug
parameters.description: Filter templates by unique slug.

parameters.name: external_id
parameters.description: The unique applications-specific identifier provided for the template via API or Embedded template form builder. It allows you to receive only templates with your specified external id.

parameters.name: folder
parameters.description: Filter templates by folder name.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: Get only archived templates instead of active ones.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of templates to return. Default value is 10. Maximum value is 100.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the template to start the list from. It allows you to receive only templates with id greater than the specified value. Pass ID value from the `pagination.next` response to load the next batch of templates.

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the template to end the list with. It allows you to receive only templates with id less than the specified value.

id.description: Unique identifier of the document template.

slug.description: Unique slug of the document template.

schema.description: List of documents attached to the template.

attachment_uuid.description: Unique indentifier of attached document to the template.

name.description: Name of the attached document to the template.

fields.description: List of fields to be filled in the template.

submitter_uuid.description: Unique identifier of the submitter that filled the field.

type.description: Type of the field (e.g., text, signature, date, initials).

required.description: Indicates if the field is required.

font_size.description: Font size of the field value in pixels.

font_type.description: Font type of the field value.

font.description: Font family of the field value.

color.description: Font color of the field value.

align.description: Horizontal alignment of the field text value.

valign.description: Vertical alignment of the field text value.

format.description: The data format for different field types.

price.description: Price value of the payment field. Only for payment fields.

currency.description: Currency value of the payment field. Only for payment fields.

mask.description: Indicates if the field is masked on the document.

areas.description: List of areas where the field is located in the document.

x.description: X coordinate of the area where the field is located in the document.

y.description: Y coordinate of the area where the field is located in the document.

w.description: Width of the area where the field is located in the document.

h.description: Height of the area where the field is located in the document.

attachment_uuid.description: Unique identifier of the attached document where the field is located.

page.description: Page number of the attached document where the field is located.

author_id.description: Unique identifier of the author of the template.

archived_at.description: Date and time when the template was archived.

created_at.description: Date and time when the template was created.

updated_at.description: Date and time when the template was updated.

external_id.description: Identifier of the template in the external system.

folder_id.description: Unique identifier of the folder where the template is placed.

folder_name.description: Folder name where the template is placed.

documents.description: List of documents attached to the template.

next.description: The ID of the tempate after which the next page starts.

prev.description: The ID of the tempate before which the previous page ends.

delete.description: The API endpoint allows you to archive a document template.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the document template.

archived_at.description: Date and time when the template was archived.

put.description: The API endpoint provides the functionality to move a document template to a different folder and update the name of the template.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the document template.

folder_name.description: The folder's name to which the template should be moved.

roles.description: An array of submitter role names to update the template with.

updated_at.description: Date and time when the template was last updated.

get.description: The API endpoint provides the ability to retrieve a list of available submissions.

parameters.name: template_id
parameters.description: The template ID allows you to receive only the submissions created from that specific template.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Filter submissions by status.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Filter submissions based on submitters name, email or phone partial match.

parameters.name: slug
parameters.description: Filter submissions by unique slug.

parameters.name: template_folder
parameters.description: Filter submissions by template folder name.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: Returns only archived submissions when `true` and only active submissions when `false`.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of submissions to return. Default value is 10. Maximum value is 100.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the submission to start the list from. It allows you to receive only submissions with an ID greater than the specified value. Pass ID value from the `pagination.next` response to load the next batch of submissions.

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the submission that marks the end of the list. It allows you to receive only submissions with an ID less than the specified value.

combined_document_url.description: Combined PDF file URL with documents and Audit Log.

completed_at.description: The date and time when the submission was completed.

created_at.description: The date and time when the submission was created.

updated_at.description: The date and time when the submission was last updated.

archived_at.description: The date and time when the submission was archived.

email.description: The email address of the submitter.

slug.description: Unique key to be used in the form signing link and embedded form.

sent_at.description: The date and time when the signing request was sent to the submitter.

opened_at.description: The date and time when the submitter opened the signing form.

completed_at.description: The date and time when the submitter completed the signing form.

declined_at.description: The date and time when the submitter declined to complete the signing form.

created_at.description: The date and time when the submitter was created.

updated_at.description: The date and time when the submitter was last updated.

external_id.description: Your application-specific unique string key to identify this submitter within your app.

status.description: The status of signing request for the submitter.

metadata.description: Metadata object with additional submitter information.

name.description: The name of the submission template.

external_id.description: Your application-specific unique string key to identify this template within your app.

folder_name.description: Folder name where the template is located.

created_at.description: The date and time when the submission template was created.

updated_at.description: The date and time when the submission template was last updated.

id.description: Unique identifier of the user who created the submission.

first_name.description: The first name of the user who created the submission.

last_name.description: The last name of the user who created the submission.

email.description: The email address of the user who created the submission.

next.description: The ID of the submission after which the next page starts.

prev.description: The ID of the submission before which the previous page ends.

post.description:
This API endpoint allows you to create signature requests (submissions) for a document template and send them to the specified submitters (signers).
Related Guides
Send documents for signature via API
Pre-fill PDF document form fields with API

template_id.description: The unique identifier of the template. Document template forms can be created via the Web UI, PDF and DOCX API, or HTML API.

send_email.description: Set `false` to disable signature request emails sending.

send_sms.description: Set `true` to send signature request via phone number and SMS.

order.description: Pass 'random' to send signature request emails to all parties right away. The order is 'preserved' by default so the second party will receive a signature request email only after the document is signed by the first party.

completed_redirect_url.description: Specify URL to redirect to after the submission completion.

bcc_completed.description: Specify BCC address to send signed documents to after the completion.

reply_to.description: Specify Reply-To address to use in the notification emails.

expire_at.description: Specify the expiration date and time after which the submission becomes unavailable for signature.

body.description: Custom signature request email body. Can include the following variables: {{template.name}}, {{submitter.link}}, {{account.name}}.

submitters.description: The list of submitters for the submission.

role.description: The role name or title of the submitter.

email.description: The email address of the submitter.

phone.description: The phone number of the submitter, formatted according to the E.164 standard.

values.description: An object with pre-filled values for the submission. Use field names for keys of the object. For more configurations see `fields` param.

external_id.description: Your application-specific unique string key to identify this submitter within your app.

completed.description: Pass `true` to mark submitter as completed and auto-signed via API.

metadata.description: Metadata object with additional submitter information.

send_email.description: Set `false` to disable signature request emails sending only for this submitter.

send_sms.description: Set `true` to send signature request via phone number and SMS.

reply_to.description: Specify Reply-To address to use in the notification emails for this submitter.

completed_redirect_url.description: Submitter specific URL to redirect to after the submission completion.

subject.description: Custom signature request email subject for the submitter.

body.description: Custom signature request email body for the submitter. Can include the following variables: {{template.name}}, {{submitter.link}}, {{account.name}}.

fields.description: A list of configurations for template document form fields.

default_value.description: Default value of the field. Use base64 encoded file or a public URL to the image file to set default signature or image fields.

readonly.description: Set `true` to make it impossible for the submitter to edit predefined field value.

required.description: Set `true` to make the field required.

title.description: Field title displayed to the user instead of the name, shown on the signing form. Supports Markdown.

description.description: Field description displayed on the signing form. Supports Markdown.

validation_pattern.description: HTML field validation pattern string based on https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/pattern specification.

invalid_message.description: A custom message to display on pattern validation failure.

font_size.description: Font size of the field value in pixels.

font_type.description: Font type of the field value.

font.description: Font family of the field value.

color.description: Font color of the field value.

align.description: Horizontal alignment of the field text value.

valign.description: Vertical alignment of the field text value.

format.description:
The data format for different field types.
- Date field: accepts formats such as DD/MM/YYYY (default: MM/DD/YYYY).
- Signature field: accepts drawn, typed, drawn_or_typed (default), or upload.
- Number field: accepts currency formats such as usd, eur, gbp.

price.description: Price value of the payment field. Only for payment fields.

currency.description: Currency value of the payment field. Only for payment fields.

mask.description: Set `true` to make sensitive data masked on the document.

roles.description: A list of roles for the submitter. Use this param to merge multiple roles into one submitter.

email.description: The email address of the submitter.

slug.description: Unique key to be used in the signing form URL.

status.description: The status of signing request for the submitter.

values.description: An array of pre-filled values for the submission.

sent_at.description: The date and time when the signing request was sent to the submitter.

opened_at.description: The date and time when the submitter opened the signing form.

completed_at.description: The date and time when the submitter completed the signing form.

declined_at.description: The date and time when the submitter declined the signing form.

created_at.description: The date and time when the submitter was created.

updated_at.description: The date and time when the submitter was last updated.

phone.description: The phone number of the submitter.

external_id.description: Your application-specific unique string key to identify this submitter within your app.

send_email.description: Indicates whether the signature request email should be sent.

send_sms.description: Indicates whether the signature request should be sent via SMS.

role.description: The role of the submitter in the signing process.

embed_src.description: The `src` URL value to embed the signing form or sign via a link.

get.description: The API endpoint provides the functionality to retrieve information about a submission.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the submission.

combined_document_url.description: Combined PDF file URL with documents and Audit Log.

created_at.description: The date and time when the submission was created.

updated_at.description: The date and time when the submission was last updated.

updated_at.description: The date and time when the submitter was last updated.

external_id.description: Your application-specific unique string key to identify this submitter within your app.

status.description: The status of signing request for the submitter.

values.description: An array of field values for the submitter.

documents.description: An array of completed or signed documents by the submitter.

role.description: The role of the submitter in the signing process.

name.description: The name of the submission template.

external_id.description: Your application-specific unique string key to identify this template within your app.

folder_name.description: Folder name where the template is located.

created_at.description: The date and time when the submission template was created.

updated_at.description: The date and time when the submission template was last updated.

id.description: Unique identifier of the user who created the submission.

first_name.description: The first name of the user who created the submission.

last_name.description: The last name of the user who created the submission.

email.description: The email address of the user who created the submission.

submitter_id.description: Unique identifier of the submitter that triggered the event.

event_timestamp.description: Date and time when the event was triggered.

documents.description: An array of completed or signed documents of the submission.

completed_at.description: The date and time when the submission was fully completed.

delete.description: The API endpoint allows you to archive a submission.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the submission.

archived_at.description: Date and time when the submission was archived.

get.description: This endpoint returns a list of partially filled documents for a submission. If the submission has been completed, the final signed documents are returned.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the submission.

post.description: This API endpoint allows you to create submissions for a document template and send them to the specified email addresses. This is a simplified version of the POST /submissions API to be used with Zapier or other automation tools.

template_id.description: The unique identifier of the template.

emails.description: A comma-separated list of email addresses to send the submission to.

send_email.description: Set `false` to disable signature request emails sending.

body.description: Custom signature request email body. Can include the following variables: {{template.name}}, {{submitter.link}}, {{account.name}}.

email.description: The email address of the submitter.

slug.description: Unique key to be used in the signing form URL.

status.description: The status of signing request for the submitter.

values.description: An array of pre-filled values for the submission.

sent_at.description: The date and time when the signing request was sent to the submitter.

opened_at.description: The date and time when the submitter opened the signing form.

completed_at.description: The date and time when the submitter completed the signing form.

declined_at.description: The date and time when the submitter declined the signing form.

created_at.description: The date and time when the submitter was created.

updated_at.description: The date and time when the submitter was last updated.

phone.description: The phone number of the submitter.

external_id.description: Your application-specific unique string key to identify this submitter within your app.

send_email.description: Indicates whether the signature request email should be sent.

send_sms.description: Indicates whether the signature request should be sent via SMS.

role.description: The role of the submitter in the signing process.

embed_src.description: The `src` URL value to embed the signing form or sign via a link.

get.description: The API endpoint provides functionality to retrieve information about a submitter, along with the submitter documents and field values.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the submitter.

email.description: The email address of the submitter.

slug.description: Unique key to be used in the form signing link and embedded form.

sent_at.description: The date and time when the signing request was sent to the submitter.

opened_at.description: The date and time when the submitter opened the signing form.

completed_at.description: The date and time when the submitter completed the signing form.

declined_at.description: The date and time when the submitter declined the signing form.

created_at.description: The date and time when the submitter was created.

updated_at.description: The date and time when the submitter was last updated.

external_id.description: The unique applications-specific identifier

metadata.description: Metadata object with additional submitter information.

submitter_id.description: Unique identifier of the submitter that triggered the event.

event_timestamp.description: Date and time when the event was triggered.

values.description: An array of pre-filled values for the submitter.

documents.description: An array of completed or signed documents by the submitter.

role.description: The role of the submitter in the signing process.

put.description:
The API endpoint allows you to update submitter details, pre-fill or update field values and re-send emails.
Related Guides
Automatically sign documents via API

required.description: Set `true` to make the field required.

validation_pattern.description: HTML field validation pattern string based on https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/pattern specification.

The data format for different field types.
- Date field: accepts formats such as DD/MM/YYYY (default: MM/DD/YYYY).
- Signature field: accepts drawn, typed, drawn_or_typed (default), or upload.
- Number field: accepts currency formats such as usd, eur, gbp.

price.description: Price value of the payment field. Only for payment fields.

currency.description: Currency value of the payment field. Only for payment fields.

mask.description: Set `true` to make sensitive data masked on the document.

slug.description: Unique key to be used in the form signing link and embedded form.

get.description: The API endpoint provides the ability to retrieve a list of submitters.

parameters.name: submission_id
parameters.description: The submission ID allows you to receive only the submitters related to that specific submission.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Filter submitters on name, email or phone partial match.

parameters.name: slug
parameters.description: Filter submitters by unique slug.

parameters.name: completed_after
parameters.description: The date and time string value to filter submitters that completed the submission after the specified date and time.

parameters.name: completed_before
parameters.description: The date and time string value to filter submitters that completed the submission before the specified date and time.

parameters.name: external_id
parameters.description: The unique applications-specific identifier provided for a submitter when initializing a signature request. It allows you to receive only submitters with a specified external id.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of submitters to return. Default value is 10. Maximum value is 100.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the submitter to start the list from. It allows you to receive only submitters with id greater than the specified value. Pass ID value from the `pagination.next` response to load the next batch of submitters.

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the submitter to end the list with. It allows you to receive only submitters with id less than the specified value.

email.description: The email address of the submitter.

slug.description: Unique slug of the submitter form.

sent_at.description: The date and time when the signing request was sent to the submitter.

opened_at.description: The date and time when the submitter opened the signing form.

completed_at.description: The date and time when the submitter completed the signing form.

declined_at.description: The date and time when the submitter declined the signing form.

created_at.description: The date and time when the submitter was created.

updated_at.description: The date and time when the submitter was last updated.

external_id.description: The unique applications-specific identifier

metadata.description: Metadata object with additional submitter information.

id.description: Unique identifier of the submission event.

submitter_id.description: Unique identifier of the submitter that triggered the event.

event_timestamp.description: Date and time when the event was triggered.

values.description: An array of pre-filled values for the submission.

documents.description: An array of completed or signed documents by the submitter.

role.description: The role of the submitter in the signing process.

next.description: The ID of the submitter after which the next page starts.

prev.description: The ID of the submitter before which the previous page ends.

put.description: The API endpoint allows you to add, remove or replace documents in the template with provided PDF/DOCX file or HTML content.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the documents template.

documents.description: The list of documents to add or replace in the template.

name.description: Document name. Random uuid will be assigned when not specified.

file.description: Base64-encoded content of the PDF or DOCX file or downloadable file URL. Leave it empty if you create a new document using HTML param.

html.description: HTML template with field tags. Leave it empty if you add a document via PDF or DOCX base64 encoded file param or URL.

position.description: Position of the document. By default will be added as the last document in the template.

replace.description: Set to `true` to replace existing document with a new file at `position`. Existing document fields will be transferred to the new document if it doesn't contain any fields.

remove.description: Set to `true` to remove existing document at given `position` or with given `name`.

merge.description: Set to `true` to merge all existing and new documents into a single PDF document in the template.

id.description: Unique identifier of the document template.

slug.description: Unique slug of the document template.

schema.description: List of documents attached to the template.

attachment_uuid.description: Unique indentifier of attached document to the template.

name.description: Name of the attached document to the template.

fields.description: List of fields to be filled in the template.

submitter_uuid.description: Unique identifier of the submitter that filled the field.

type.description: Type of the field (e.g., text, signature, date, initials).

required.description: Indicates if the field is required.

font_size.description: Font size of the field value in pixels.

font_type.description: Font type of the field value.

font.description: Font family of the field value.

color.description: Font color of the field value.

align.description: Horizontal alignment of the field text value.

valign.description: Vertical alignment of the field text value.

format.description: The data format for different field types.

price.description: Price value of the payment field. Only for payment fields.

currency.description: Currency value of the payment field. Only for payment fields.

mask.description: Indicates if the field is masked on the document.

areas.description: List of areas where the field is located in the document.

x.description: X coordinate of the area where the field is located in the document.

y.description: Y coordinate of the area where the field is located in the document.

w.description: Width of the area where the field is located in the document.

h.description: Height of the area where the field is located in the document.

attachment_uuid.description: Unique identifier of the attached document where the field is located.

page.description: Page number of the attached document where the field is located.

author_id.description: Unique identifier of the author of the template.

archived_at.description: Date and time when the template was archived.

created_at.description: Date and time when the template was created.

updated_at.description: Date and time when the template was updated.

external_id.description: Identifier of the template in the external system.

folder_id.description: Unique identifier of the folder where the template is placed.

folder_name.description: Folder name where the template is placed.

documents.description: List of documents attached to the template.

post.description: The API endpoint allows you to clone existing template into a new template.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the documents template.

name.description: Template name. Existing name with (Clone) suffix will be used if not specified.

folder_name.description: The folder's name to which the template should be cloned.

external_id.description: Your application-specific unique string key to identify this template within your app.

id.description: Unique identifier of the document template.

slug.description: Unique slug of the document template.

schema.description: List of documents attached to the template.

post.description:
The API endpoint provides the functionality to seamlessly generate a PDF document template by utilizing the provided HTML content while incorporating pre-defined fields.
Related Guides
Create PDF document fillable form with HTML

html.example: Lorem Ipsum is simply dummy text of the and typesetting industry

html_header.description: HTML template of the header to be displayed on every page.

html_footer.description: HTML template of the footer to be displayed on every page.

name.description: Template name. Random uuid will be assigned when not specified.

size.description: Page size. Letter 8.5 x 11 will be assigned when not specified.

external_id.description: Your application-specific unique string key to identify this template within your app. Existing template with specified `external_id` will be updated with a new HTML.

folder_name.description: The folder's name to which the template should be created.

documents.description: The list of documents built from HTML. Can be used to create a template with multiple documents. Leave `documents` param empty when using a top-level `html` param for a template with a single document.

html.example: Lorem Ipsum is simply dummy text of the and typesetting industry

post.summary: Create a template from Word DOCX
post.description:
The API endpoint provides the functionality to create a fillable document template for existing Microsoft Word document. Use {{Field Name;role=Signer1;type=date}} text tags to define fillable fields in the document. See https://www.docuseal.com/examples/fieldtags.docx for more text tag formats. Or specify the exact pixel coordinates of the document fields using `fields` param.
Related Guides
Use embedded text field tags to create a fillable form

external_id.description: Your application-specific unique string key to identify this template within your app. Existing template with specified `external_id` will be updated with a new document.

folder_name.description: The folder's name to which the template should be created.

file.description: Base64-encoded content of the DOCX file or downloadable file URL

fields.description: Fields are optional if you use {{...}} text tags to define fields in the document.

type.description: Type of the field (e.g., text, signature, date, initials).

required.description: Indicates if the field is required.

title.description: Field title displayed to the user instead of the name, shown on the signing form. Supports Markdown.

description.description: Field description displayed on the signing form. Supports Markdown.

page.description: Page number of the field area. Starts from 1.

option.description: Option string value for 'radio' and 'multiple' select field types.

options.description: An array of option values for 'select' field type.

font_size.description: Font size of the field value in pixels.

font_type.description: Font type of the field value.

font.description: Font family of the field value.

color.description: Font color of the field value.

align.description: Horizontal alignment of the field text value.

valign.description: Vertical alignment of the field text value.

format.description:
The data format for different field types.
- Date field: accepts formats such as DD/MM/YYYY (default: MM/DD/YYYY).
- Signature field: accepts drawn, typed, drawn_or_typed (default), or upload.
- Number field: accepts currency formats such as usd, eur, gbp.

price.description: Price value of the payment field. Only for payment fields.

currency.description: Currency value of the payment field. Only for payment fields.

mask.description: Set `true` to make sensitive data masked on the document.

slug.description: Unique slug of the document template.

fields.description: List of fields to be filled in the template.

color.description: Font color of the field value.

align.description: Horizontal alignment of the field text value.

valign.description: Vertical alignment of the field text value.

format.description: The data format for different field types.

price.description: Price value of the payment field. Only for payment fields.

currency.description: Currency value of the payment field. Only for payment fields.

mask.description: Indicates if the field is masked on the document.

areas.description: List of areas where the field is located in the document.

x.description: X coordinate of the area where the field is located in the document.

y.description: Y coordinate of the area where the field is located in the document.

w.description: Width of the area where the field is located in the document.

h.description: Height of the area where the field is located in the document.

attachment_uuid.description: Unique identifier of the attached document where the field is located.

page.description: Page number of the attached document where the field is located.

author_id.description: Unique identifier of the author of the template.

created_at.description: Date and time when the template was created.

updated_at.description: Date and time when the template was updated.

external_id.description: Identifier of the template in the external system.

folder_id.description: Unique identifier of the folder where the template is placed.

folder_name.description: Folder name where the template is placed.

post.summary: Create a template from existing PDF
post.description:
The API endpoint provides the functionality to create a fillable document template for existing PDF file. Use {{Field Name;role=Signer1;type=date}} text tags to define fillable fields in the document. See https://www.docuseal.com/examples/fieldtags.pdf for more text tag formats. Or specify the exact pixel coordinates of the document fields using `fields` param.
Related Guides
Use embedded text field tags to create a fillable form

folder_name.description: The folder's name to which the template should be created.

external_id.description: Your application-specific unique string key to identify this template within your app. Existing template with specified `external_id` will be updated with a new PDF.

file.description: Base64-encoded content of the PDF file or downloadable file URL.

fields.description: Fields are optional if you use {{...}} text tags to define fields in the document.

type.description: Type of the field (e.g., text, signature, date, initials).

required.description: Indicates if the field is required.

title.description: Field title displayed to the user instead of the name, shown on the signing form. Supports Markdown.

description.description: Field description displayed on the signing form. Supports Markdown.

page.description: Page number of the field area. Starts from 1.

option.description: Option string value for 'radio' and 'multiple' select field types.

options.description: An array of option values for 'select' field type.

font_size.description: Font size of the field value in pixels.

font_type.description: Font type of the field value.

font.description: Font family of the field value.

color.description: Font color of the field value.

align.description: Horizontal alignment of the field text value.

valign.description: Vertical alignment of the field text value.

format.description:
The data format for different field types.
- Date field: accepts formats such as DD/MM/YYYY (default: MM/DD/YYYY).
- Signature field: accepts drawn, typed, drawn_or_typed (default), or upload.
- Number field: accepts currency formats such as usd, eur, gbp.

price.description: Price value of the payment field. Only for payment fields.

currency.description: Currency value of the payment field. Only for payment fields.

mask.description: Set `true` to make sensitive data masked on the document.

flatten.description: Remove PDF form fields from the document.

remove_tags.description: Pass `false` to disable the removal of {{text}} tags from the PDF. This can be used along with transparent text tags for faster and more robust PDF processing.

post.description: The API endpoint allows you to merge multiple templates with documents and fields into a new combined template.

template_ids.description: An array of template ids to merge into a new template.

name.description: Template name. Existing name with (Merged) suffix will be used if not specified.

folder_name.description: The name of the folder in which the merged template should be placed.

external_id.description: Your application-specific unique string key to identify this template within your app.

roles.description: An array of submitter role names to be used in the merged template.
